text: TBH I find this going paperless lark a bloody nuisance. You have to remember all these different usernames,pins and passwords because of the cyber crims,and invariably find you've forgotten which one you used if it's a while ago that you last accessed it. You find yourself kept in the dark. I prefer to have the info on paper where I can review it at a glance - no scrolling required! - and decide quickly upon my course of action.
author: Ralph Jackson

text: I think I'll keep my thermostat where I like it,but I don't use any heating at all between the later part of May and somewhere between the middle of October and early November,whereas some people I talk to seem to reach for it in all but the warmest couple of months of summer. I rarely need it in daytime outside the period between the late autumn and the early part of March. My energy usage overall isn't any bigger than theirs and can be significantly lower.

text:
How To Reduce Pollution

1. Many Production Companies Has To Be Stopped

From global warming or climate change there is going to be mass extinctions of humans and wildlife, we do not know when, but from pollution also we are going to face mass extinction.
We manufacture so many products and it is creating pollution and pollution has increased to such an extent that it has become a threat to the world. So if we minimise our products, pollution would be less.
We produce so many things which we do not need as a necessity, like cold drinks, leather products, potato wafers, chips, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. Cold drinks, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. should be cooked at home only. Instead of cold drinks people should drink natural drinks such as lime water, coconut water or just any fruit, not any fruit juice, just the whole fruit which can be served when a customer comes in a shop, hotel or a person selling this drinks on a street and serve it to him. If we stopped producing this things which are not required as a necessity for humans, so much pollution could be reduced.
What about the companies that are going to be shut down. They would have debts to pay, just excuse them.
If we colour the clothes pollution occurs. So if we don't colour our clothes, the pollution resulting from colouring the clothes can be stopped. Let everything remain in white natural colour. 

2. We Should Cook Foods In Its Natural Form

We can cook rice and wheat in our homes and eat it. Rice and Wheat is produced in farms. Then it is packed and transported to big warehouses, then wholesalers buy from them and supply to retail shops. 
But if a manufacturing company makes bread from rice and wheat, then to make bread a manufacturing company has to be set up, machines and working staffs are needed. When a company is built many other things are also needed. Then at last a plastic pack is required to pack the breads.
So if we start cooking eatable things in its natural form then we do not need many companies like bread manufacturing company, tomato ketchup, noodles, fruit jam, pizza, burger, etc., the things required for the company and the plastic pack, paper box pack and glass bottles. If done like this, so many companies will not be required and hence less pollution for the world. Humans have to do this before it is too late.

If this is done, then many jobs would be lost. For that many peoples should do farming and they should be given loans if they do not have enough money to start farming on their own. Many people's should do agriculture and farming. Many people should study botany subject so that they have knowledge of plants and they should do farming.
Is their any another solution, that humans won't lose jobs and also planet earth will be saved.
Industrial jobs or planet earth, which should we save, planet earth is more important. Humans have to take this step certainly instead of going on polluting the earth, making wildlife extinct and also mass extinctions of humans after 100 or 200 years. Humans should not want this to happen.

text:
How To Live In Harmony With Nature And Reduce Pollution

¬†

1. Many Production Companies Which We Do Not Need Actually For Human Beings Has To Be Stopped

¬†

We manufacture so many products and it is creating pollution. So if we minimise our products, pollution would be less.

We produce so many things which we do not need, like cold drinks, leather products, potato wafers, chips, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. 

Cold drinks, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. should be cooked at home only. If we stopped producing this things which are not required for humans, so much pollution could be reduced.

If we colour the clothes pollution occurs. So if we don't colour our clothes, the pollution resulting from colouring the clothes can be stopped. Let everything remain in white natural colour. 

¬†

2. We Should Cook Foods In Its Natural Form

¬†

We can cook rice and wheat in our homes and eat it. Rice and Wheat is produced in farms. Then it is packed and transported to big warehouses, then wholesalers buy from them and supply to retail shops. 

But if a manufacturing company makes bread from rice and wheat, then to make bread a manufacturing company has to be set up, machines and working staffs are needed. When a company is built many other things are also needed. Then at last a plastic pack is required to pack the breads.

So if we start cooking eatable things in its natural form then we do not need many companies like bread manufacturing company, tomato ketchup, noodles, fruit jam, pizza, burger, etc., the things required for the company and the plastic pack, paper box pack and glass bottles. If done like this, so many companies will not be required and hence less pollution for the world. 

Also we could save our money like this. If you buy a packet of bread, it would cost you more money than if you cook wheat and rice in home.

Previously before industrial revolution, we didn't have technology, but our foods were rich with nutrients. Now we have technology,¬† but our foods are not rich with nutrients. 

If this is done, then many jobs would be lost. For that many peoples should do farming and they should be given loans if they do not have enough money to start farming on their own.

Food, Medicines, Surgeries and Education's should be made free to the world till the world settles down with farming. After that food, medicines, surgeries and education's should be stopped free to the world.

Many people should study botany subject so that they have knowledge of plants and they should do farming.

Is their any another solution, that humans won't lose jobs and also pollution would decrease. Humans have to take this step certainly instead of going on polluting the earth, making wildlife extinct and also mass extinctions of humans in future.

¬†

3. Electricity Pollution

¬†

We create electricity from many types of sources like coal, water, etc., but it creates pollution. If electricity created from windmill and solar energy then no pollution occurs in the creation process. But still to manufacture windmill and solar machines pollution would occur.

As I previously said that if we shut down many manufacturing companies which are producing things which are not needed for humans, then the world would not require so much electricity. If less electricity required, then less pollution generated.

¬†

4. Could We Stop Drinking Cow's and Buffalo's Milk

¬†

Whatever vitamins and nutrients we get from milk, if we can get it from other eatable things, then we can stop drinking cow's and buffalo's milk. As milk has to be packed in glass bottles and plastic packs and then transported to places. All of this can be stopped. 

For infants whose mother's have died or mother's who cannot breast feed their infants, only for them cow's and buffalo's milk should be given. We use milk in tea and coffee. Instead of milk we must use lime with tea and coffee or just plain tea and coffee. A lime should be cut into a few pieces and cooked with tea and coffee or something else can be used instead of lime.

Earth Day... countdown to DEATH DAY! As the world stands in ignorance as the end of life on Earth in 20 years stares at it from the Sun whose history has shown that it can coble up any planet all the people ponder on what to do. As the Ice Age ends in 2023 as no more summer ice floats in Arctic's oceans due to Russia's attempts to warm up their whole country every year with multiple military maneuvers across their whole country that added much warmed to their area of the Earth which caused the weakest ice on Earth, permafrost, to melt and flow into the oceans in the Arctic. This permafrost melting water entering the oceans has been going on since the 1950's when humans started flying jet engine planes instead of propeller planes. Also humans in the 1950's started using rockets. Today we are shooting up rockets every week and flying over 100,000 military and passenger jets a day worldwide everyday! The heat of the rockets exhaust ranged as hot as the SUN for the SPACE SHUTTLE and around 5800 F for rockets. Jets are gigantic vacuum and heating machines that sucking up our molecules in our atmosphere which the planet needs to create keep Earth's washing machine and water maker running which are clouds and rain.
 The warmer waters from melted ice from the poles travel around the globe and  as they melt the South Pole's ice in 2025 it will begin to collapse in mass. Then waters throughout the world will flood the low lying areas of the planet. People will drown and nuclear plants will be destroyed and it's radioactive waste polluting the world's oceans and water ways. Civilization will collapse as everyone and every animal thereafter will forever have to scramble for water and food. This is your world starting in 2023 when the North Pole has no more summer ice. The Earth will quickly progress from one disaster after another as tornadoes, hurricanes, droughts and rainstorms travel around the world causing havoc. Volcano eruptions will happen numerously as water enters the Earth and turns up the tea pot pressure on volcanoes worldwide. Once the cloud system disappears in about 2030 due to not enough trees to provide what nature needs to make clouds then the Sun will bake and evaporate all the water from the Earth within years. 
   You can stop it if EVERYONE stops flying jet planes and rockets of ALL kinds. Then we have to stop using combustion engine machines of all kinds, end fracking, repair leaking gas wells and more which I will soon write about. Also very important that we do all we can now to save all the ice in the North and South Poles. We will do this by collecting all the melted water from melted ice in the poles whenever possible, wherever possible and refreeze the water in the winter months. We will turn return the then refrozen ice to the valleys of the poles where we will layer it in hanging sheets over all the ice in the North and South Poles. WE will chop up and anchor large detached icebergs back onto the mountain ridges where they will stay to cool the waters. We can also redo all our dwellings with this thing called 'Cool Walls which will cool and heat all our dwellings. text:
WANT TO HELP SAVE THE PLANET?  Here are 6 things every person can do NOW to save the Earth:
1.  Go VEGAN.   (food, clothes, accessories, toiletries, make-up, furniture etc.)
2.  Consume products LESS and become an INFORMED consumer.  
        -  Don't buy anything new (except if necessary, like medicine or contact lenses).  You can buy basically everything USED or make it yourself.  
        -  Do your RESEARCH before buying anything.  Many products are destroying the environment via the extraction of raw materials, production process, transportation...    
           Also production lines are full of human labor abuses.  Do your RESEARCH if you must buy something.  Remember, your purchase of a product acts to support that 
           company and everything that went into that product.
        - If you don't know 100% how a product was made at each and every step, then **do NOT buy the product**. You could be unknowingly supporting the extinction of 
          orangutans in Indonesia (ex. palm oil) or the destruction of the Amazon Rainforest (ex. beef).  No joke.  Stop buying products unless you are 100% informed.  Don't be 
          selfish.  You don't need most products.  Buy it used at eBay/Craigslist/Goodwill or make it yourself instead of contributing to the destruction of the planet.
              - Check if the product has any certifications, such as:  RainforestAlliance, FairTrade, RSPO - Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil, USDA Organic etc.
        - Stop buying via Amazon!!!  It has rampant human rights abuses that have been clearly reported on many times, including abuses and neglect during COVID-19.  In addition, 
          despite some of its 'climate pledges', Amazon has a terrible negative impact on the environment.  Think factories, energy-usages, packing for all of those boxes, carbon  
          emissions for the trucks that deliver them etc.  If you buy via Amazon you are supporting human rights abuses and environmental degradation.  Do you really need that 
          product?  Just buy it used or at least directly form the actual company.  Don't be selfish, be responsible.
3.  Go plastic and packaging free.  Don't buy ANYTHING with non-compostable packaging, or that's made of non-environmental material.  If you do, make sure it's recyclable and       
      recycle it properly.
4.  ADOPT and REDUCE family sizes.  
        - Humans have overpopulated the world and are destroying the environment as a result, especially people living in 'modernized' countries.  The human population is almost 
           at 8 billion.  We need to intelligently and voluntarily work to get our numbers down to at least half of that.  It is a very personal issue, but please consider adopting children 
           instead of creating new children.  There are currently over 100 million orphan children living in the world today.  Consider adopting!  Save a life, save the planet.
         - If having biological children, please consider smaller family sizes.  
         - Donate money and/or volunteer at organizations that support women's rights and literacy.  On average, women's illiteracy rates are inversely related to the number of 
           children they have.  I.e. the number of children a woman has decreases as she becomes literate and more educated.  Here are some ideas:  Room to Read, World Literacy   
           Foundation, Malala Fund, UNICEF, Campaign for Female Education (CAMFED), Afghan Institute of Learning, Invest in Girls, Educate Girls, AGE Africa, Asante Africa 
           Foundation, She‚Äôs the First, Forum for African Women Educationalists (FAWE).
5. VOTE and become politically informed!  Make sure to stay politically informed and pressure your local, state and national representatives to support issues and legislation 
     that save and protect the environment and species.  VOTE during all elections!
6. Use only RENEWABLE energy and use LESS of it.  
   - Buy carbon offsets from a reliable company for your yearly energy usage.
   - STOP FLYING unless absolutely necessary (and buy carbon offsets if you do).  Walk, bike, ride a velomobile, use public transportation instead of gas-powered cars.
   - See if your energy company has an option for you to buy green energy or support green energy initiatives. Install your own renewable energy sources, like solar panels.
   - Be conscious throughout your day and use as little energy as possible.  Ex. instead of turning on the heat, just wear a few more layers and close the windows.

We can save the planet if everyone just does their part.  Everyone please act NOW!  

Check out these presentations for more info on human impacts on the environment and what you can do to help:  
Save the Planet:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YP83Qz6TabM
Animal Agriculture:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bxHVmJTMz90

text:
10 Things You Can Do to Help Save the Earth

¬†

¬†

¬†

BY¬†KATIE LAMBERT¬†&¬†SARAH GLEIM

Ôøº

We have no planet B. This composite image of Earth was captured by six orbits of the NASA/NOAA Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership spacecraft on April 9, 2015, by the Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) instrument.¬†NASA

Advertisement

The United Nations suggests that¬†climate change is not just the defining issue of our time, but we are also at a defining moment in history. Weather patterns are changing and will threaten food production, and sea levels are rising and could cause catastrophic flooding across the globe. Countries must make drastic actions to avoid a future with irreversible damage to major ecosystems and planetary climate.

But what about individuals? What can we do to pitch in and help save the Earth? There are plenty of things you can do every day to help reduce greenhouse gases and your¬†carbon footprint¬†to make a less harmful impact on the environment. Taking care of the Earth is not just a responsibility, it's a necessity. ¬≠In that spirit, HowStuffWorks has come up with 10 things you can do now to help save the planet.

1. Conserve Water

The little things can make a big difference. Every time you turn off the water while you're brushing your teeth, you're doing something good. Got a leaky faucet? You might be dripping as much as 90 gallons (340 liters) of water down the drain every day [source:¬†EPA]. So fix it! It's easy and cheap. And stop drinking¬†bottled water. Switch to filtered tap water. You'll save a ton of cash and help reduce a ton of plastic waste in the process.

2. Be Car-conscious

If you can, stay off the road two days a week or more. You'll reduce greenhouse gas emissions by an average of 1,590 pounds (721 kilograms) per year [source:¬†EPA]. It's easier than you think. You can combine your errands ‚Äî hit the school, grocery store and dog daycare in one trip. And talk to your boss about teleworking. It's a boon for you and your company. But being car conscious also means maintaining your car on a regular basis. You can improve your gas mileage by 0.6 percent to 3 percent by keeping your tires inflated to the proper pressure, and be sure to make necessary repairs if your car fails emission [source:¬†EPA].

3. Walk, Bike or Take Public Transit

Walking and biking are obvious ways to reduce greenhouse gases. Plus you'll get some good cardio and¬†burn some calories¬†while you do it. If you live in an area that's not¬†walkable, take advantage of your local¬†mass transit¬†if you can. Or carpool. Even one car off on the road makes a difference.

4. Reduce, Reuse, Recycle

You can help reduce pollution just by putting that soda can in the¬†recycling¬†bin. It really does make a difference. Paper, too. Case in point: If an office building of 7,000 workers recycled all of its office paper waste for a year, it would be the equivalent of taking almost 400 cars off the road [source:¬†EPA]. But you can also take reusable bags to the grocery, and avoid using disposable plates, spoons, glass, cups and napkins. They create huge amounts of waste. And buy products that are made of recycled materials. It all makes a difference.

5. Give Composting a Try

In 2015, (the last year figures were available) Americans generated¬†262.4 million tons (238 metric tons) of trash. Only 23.4 million tons (21.2 metric tons) of that was composted. Some was recycled and some was combusted for energy, but almost half of it ‚Äî 137.7 million tons (124.9 metric tons) ‚Äî ended up in the¬†landfill. Imagine if you could divert more of that to your own¬†compost? It would help reduce the amount of solid waste you produce, and what eventually winds up in your local landfill. Plus, compost makes a great natural fertilizer.

text: It sucks how simple this stuff is and how nothing can be done if only a few individuals follow these steps. I want to do my part to save this planet, but not eating meat one day out of the week won‚Äôt change anything. Not driving a car as often as I can won‚Äôt change anything. It is going to take a lot more than just a handful of people to make any of these changes. I feel like following these steps is almost pointless because I know I‚Äôm not making a difference at all. The world clock still ticks closer to the end date. Factories keep churning, millions of other cars keep burning, livestock is still slaughtered regardless of if I‚Äôm eating it or not.... There has to be a universal solution, this can‚Äôt be done unless it‚Äôs one size fits all

text:
Save the earth was a popular thing around a few months ago. I believe nobody cares about climate change anymore. To be honest it got worse. I live in Romania, a country towards the south east of Europe, and it‚Äôs usually pretty cold. This weekend it was 46 degrees Celsius. I‚Äôm no expert but I believe that is around 100 degrees Fahrenheit. Can you imagine that? It wasn‚Äôt even livable outside. I couldn‚Äôt stand out there for 5 minutes. It was way too hot. I feel like nobody is adressing climate change anymore and that is really sad. People have to be more aware. 

Take as an example Notre Dame: The roof burned. 0 were killed, 3 injured. A lot of people addressed it, billions were donated.

As for climate change? The damage will be irreversible and it‚Äôs only OUR generation that can save it.

This comment might draw some hate, but if you have nothing nice to say, or any tips on actually saving the planet I suggest you don‚Äôt reply.

text:
more tips: 
-unplug electronic when you‚Äôre not using them. especially things you only use occasionally, just keep them unplugged until you use them. keeping them plugged in even when they‚Äôre not on uses energy!!
-don‚Äôt recycle things with grease on them because they could stain the rest of the batch and all of it will have to be thrown away. please wash it off before recycling!
-use ecosia!!! this is a search engine that profits from you making searches and uses the profits to plant trees!! it works 100% just as good as google/safari plus makes you feel good after searching on it
-hang dry your clothes! dryers are really bad for the environment and most clothes aren‚Äôt meant to be thrown in a dryer anyway, get a cute lil clothes drying rack or hang them up outside <3
-support local small businesses instead of large damaging factory businesses 
-for ppl with periods: try a diva cup or period underwear! if you have a period for say 38 years you produce a total of about 62,415 pounds of JUST period waste. wow. please at least try more sustainable options, i use period underwear and it‚Äôs shockingly effective and an amazing investment.

please do everything you can for our beautiful earth and her animals <3

text:
How To Reduce Pollution

1. Many Production Companies Has To Be Stopped

From global warming or climate change there is going to be mass extinctions of humans and wildlife, we do not know when, but from pollution also we are going to face mass extinction.
We manufacture so many products and it is creating pollution and pollution has increased to such an extent that it has become a threat to the world. So if we minimise our products, pollution would be less.
We produce so many things which we do not need as a necessity, like cold drinks, leather products, potato wafers, chips, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. Cold drinks, fruit juices, chocolates, biscuits, pickles, ice creams, etc. should be cooked at home only. Instead of cold drinks people should drink natural drinks such as lime water, coconut water or just any fruit, not any fruit juice, just the whole fruit which can be served when a customer comes in a shop, hotel or a person selling this drinks on a street and serve it to him. If we stopped producing this things which are not required as a necessity for humans, so much pollution could be reduced.
What about the companies that are going to be shut down. They would have debts to pay, just excuse them.
If we colour the clothes pollution occurs. So if we don't colour our clothes, the pollution resulting from colouring the clothes can be stopped. Let everything remain in white natural colour. 

2. We Should Cook Foods In Its Natural Form

We can cook rice and wheat in our homes and eat it. Rice and Wheat is produced in farms. Then it is packed and transported to big warehouses, then wholesalers buy from them and supply to retail shops. 
But if a manufacturing company makes bread from rice and wheat, then to make bread a manufacturing company has to be set up, machines and working staffs are needed. When a company is built many other things are also needed. Then at last a plastic pack is required to pack the breads.
So if we start cooking eatable things in its natural form then we do not need many companies like bread manufacturing company, tomato ketchup, noodles, fruit jam, pizza, burger, etc., the things required for the company and the plastic pack, paper box pack and glass bottles. If done like this, so many companies will not be required and hence less pollution for the world. Humans have to do this before it is too late.

If this is done, then many jobs would be lost. For that many peoples should do farming and they should be given loans if they do not have enough money to start farming on their own. Many people's should do agriculture and farming. Many people should study botany subject so that they have knowledge of plants and they should do farming.
Is their any another solution, that humans won't lose jobs and also planet earth will be saved.
Industrial jobs or planet earth, which should we save, planet earth is more important. Humans have to take this step certainly instead of going on polluting the earth, making wildlife extinct and also mass extinctions of humans after 100 or 200 years. Humans should not want this to happen.

text: I wanna start a petition at my middle school next year to not use or waste paper on unimportant things such as scratch paper, regular blank paper, assignments, anything we don‚Äôt really need. We can still do homework on electronics which is easier to carry around, we are saving trees, and it can‚Äôt get lost. Scratch paper is just a waste, we have electronics to do random work on it, calculators, drawings apps, the app Notes, etc. blank papers are a waste. We don‚Äôt need them period. Now we obviously need important papers such as birth certificates, records, books, etc. We can still do art such as sketches and projects on paper, but we need to actually know what we‚Äôre doing with it before because everyone messes up and then uses another paper, then messes up and uses another, then another, and another, and another. I have this healthy living class and we were talking about recycling and I had brought up the fact that we don‚Äôt recycle during lunch and we had to make a bin OURSELVES because no one else would. We can also stop throwing waste away and we can start composting(we already do this at our school), we can fix a lot of things at school honestly, it‚Äôs one of the main culprits.

text:
Here a few ways to cut down!
-Turn brightness down on device
-Eat meat only from your local butcher or from free range industries
-Turn off lights as much as possible
-DON'T BE LAZY! WALK WHEN YOU CAN!
-Only eat line caught fish, eating net caught fish supports a catastrophic industry that destroys coral reefs
-Buy less commercial, instead of buying 'Presidents Choice' products buy fresh foods from your local store
-Take shorter showers
-Flush toilet sparingly
-HERES A HUGE FACTOR! LISTEN UP OK!
Whatever amount of food you eat, you can cut down.  The human body processes food at optimal efficiency when properly hydrated.  If you eat 4000 calories a day but don't have enough water you will effectively have the same calorie gain as someone who eats 2000 calories a day but has lots of water.

text:
What's a bit depressing to me is that either way, nothing ever will be 100% climate friendly.
- Cars powered by fossil fuels are bad and I don't think I need to explain why.
- Electric cars (as explained previously) need huge batteries that contain rare elements. Mining for those elements emits HUGE amounts of greenhouses gases, and disposing the batteries is problematic.
- Not even horses and carriages would help much. Horses need food, a lot of it if they carry you around all day. And that food has to come from somewhere. Forests are cut down to make room to grow the crops, fertilizer is used in unholy amounts which is also terrible for the environment, and the calory conversion rate of horses is bad too. Only about 1/7 of the energy in the crops is available for the horse, the rest goes into keeping it alive and kicking. Couple that with overpopulation and the growing need for food and you're destined to be doomed.

text: We in the rich nations with our extravagant lifestyles are causing the destruction of the earth systems that otherwise keep everything in balance.   Our way of living may not seem extravagant to us but each of us has power over nature that was undreamed of by the kings of the past.  We consider it normal to   drive an automobile,  murder billions of our fellow creatures every year to eat and consume vast quantities of things which we then throw away.   This profligate way of life has never happened before and there is no way it can be sustained. The suggestions in this video are not not nearly enough.  Whether we are forced to change by utter catastrophe are we choose to it,  we must all start living simple lives in balance with nature.

text:
Life Noggin
I do think it is nice that you want to help teach people to save the world. You know since you, I, them and all  our children and their children and their children kind of need this planet to live. Very nice of you Mr. Noggin. 
   You do know that you are only teaching the people in the ‚ÄúWestern‚Äù part of the world. The West is not like the Rest. Have you every gone for a walk and come home covered in black soot?  You know one of those walks where you literally choke on the soot from cars, buses, trucks, and motorcycles. You can actually see cobweb like chunks floating in it and feel it sticking to your throat. Have you ever been on the top of a hill over looking the valley and see the thick black cloud canvassing the valley. And then see it happening over and over on every valley simultaneously as you journey onward? 
   I live on an island in Southeast Asia with a population of more than 140 million people. 140 million people all driving motor vehicles pouring out this unsavory toxic black smoke. The worst part of the day is between 6am and 10pm and there is no one in this world with a plan to stop this problem. And we have not even begun to talk about the industrial part of the problem. You see when a Western Corporation pays a bribe to the local governments here it really does nothing to help the environment. Have you ever watched mothers bathing their children with river water polluted with trash, toxic chemicals and heavy metals? But hey, you got your toys so don't rock the boat or you just might fall in and catch some toxic disease. 
   However, one thing people here do not have to worry about are things like tigers and crocodiles. They're all dead. Most of them died when people chopped down the rain forest to kill the ghosts that haunt them. The leader was smart to have them do that because it freed up the land for his rice fields and palm oil plantains. Hmmmm.... Well now that I think about it. Everything seems normal and fine. Maybe you should go back to doing whatever it was that you were doing and forget about what I've just said. Bye, got to go.
author: Harry Butlocks

text:
Although composting is not really difficult, it is often hard to get the necessary carbon to do the job safely at home. Even worm farms can generate fruit flies and other vermin. One really good solution to this problem would be the formation, in your area, of a community composting team. If you live anywhere in fire prone areas, the forest and scrub needs to be kept clean, and the forest fuel overburden harvested. This vital activity is overlooked, and fire is the result. Often fire is used as a control mechanism, but this is inherently hazardous and wasteful. It is precisely the carbon residuals in the forest or bushland that can provide the large volumes of absorbent carbon which are necessary for efficient, safe composting, and resulting with properly made compost. 
Forest management pays terrific dividends and the work extends far beyond simply harvesting trees.  At the same time, households are net nitrogen producers. Household organic wastes amount to many tonnes per annum for most families, and few of them have sufficient carboniferous resources at hand for trouble free composting. One part nitrogen to thirty to fifty parts carbon is the ratio necessary for perfect humification, so forest fuel is the ideal medium for processing the household nitrogen. If the resulting compost is shared half and half between the forest and our food supply, it would be a marriage made in heaven.

text:
A lot of you might say "My contribution is too small so it doesn't matter if I [insert inconvinient thing] or not" but I don't think it's a valid argument.
First, lets assume that if every single person will contributed to climate change, the world will be a better place. Don't think so? Fine! But that is another argument entirely, which could be true, but it isn't what I am trying to prove wrong. The thing is- By "a better place", I include the fact that people will be less happy by eating less meat and being in an higher / lower temperature. Let's name the level of "awesomness" that goes up from this- A. As A includes ALL of the suffering from not having air conditioning, if A is positive (ie if the world became a better place), then it was worth it. and if A is positive, the avarage change a single person makes is still positive, which means that he helped the world more than he suffered! (You can also think of it like that- if you help the world only a little by turning air conditioning off, don't you also make the world suffer only a tiny bit by doing so?)
The other reason is simply that by willingly doing inconvinient things to slow climate change, it becomes more accepted in your small community / freinds, which means that more people will do those things, and your friends may spread it, so your influance becomes much bigger than you think!

text: There is a common misconception that veganism is unnatural. Now I see where people are going with this but I have to respectfully disagree. It is not unnatural. The reason for that is our stomach is way longer than an omnivore. For herbivores, they have a longer stomach because vegitation is easier  to digest than meat. omnivores, on the other hand, have a shorter digestive system so they can digest meat faster. Humans also have flat teeth that can move side to side, unlike an omnivore, which have teeth that only move up and down. I hope this lets people see this in another light

text:
Yeah, human influence in climate change is negligible and the CO2 claim is questionable at best. Governmental responses are nothing more than a scam at income redistribution (not their income of course). Face it, if a agency has to build computer models so grossly out from reality, "tweak" the data to arrive at the "correct conclusion", and bloviate about a non-existent super-majority consensus, and spread near-future hysteria which is repeatedly demonstrated as fallacious fiction, then the problem is less critical than proposed or is simply an common process of nature.

However, that does not mean we should just ignore actions to keep our environment more livable. Although it would be easier to just toss garbage on the floor of an office or ignore maintaining factors such as sweeping and dusting, cleaning up spills and crumbs, etc. our health would suffer from ignoring acts which help us in the long run. We have reduced air pollution in the U.S. which was a serious threat in my youth and cleaned up the waterways to where few sources would result in death from ingestion. Unfortunately, the marketing and propaganda teams which scared us about our public water has produced a greater threat via the billions of plastic bottles just sent to landfills. At least the glass soda bottles of my youth had an incentive to return them for a small credit and produced less pollution during their recycling cycle.

text:
List of FIVE things you could do right now to change CO2 problem. That you‚Äôve probably never heard of before.


Join Charity Miles:
An app like pokemon go that tracks you while you go outside and for each mile, you are able to donate to a charity. Including some that plant a tree for each donation. BONUS save on gas and lower your CO2 by walking or biking to places instead of driving to them.


Switch to Ecosia:
Plant a tree for searching the web. The web browser had just as much information on it as Google, but for every 45 searches and 10 advertisements you see online, a tree is planted. It‚Äôs the easiest switch to start helping the planet. 


Play Tree Planet:
An app that plants trees for every download and wins points by playing fun games to go toward planting more!


HTC Power:
Download the HTC Power To Give and connect your Android smartphone when you go to bed.
Your HTC smartphone‚Äôs processing power will fuel a research-based grid aimed at solving the world‚Äôs biggest questions. Contribute to human needs in the fields of medicine, science and environmental causes with HTC Power To Give.


Rocketbook:
A reusable notebook! The fewer trees we cut down for paper the better, and this notebook can be reused hundreds of times for school, work or writing notes. Once a page is full, take a picture and a digital copy of your work will be made, so you never lose your work and can study or see your notes on the go. AND when its full, pop it in the microwave and watch as everything disappears! Use again and again and never worry about buying another notebook again!


BONUS:


Houseplants: 
Clearing CO2 with trees is a good start, but clearing CO2 with houseplants can also help reduce a lot of CO2 produced. Researchers say that Japanese royal ferns, spider plants, Boston ferns, purple waffle plants, English ivy, areca palms, golden pothos, aloe vera, air plants, snake plants, and peace lilies are the best CO2 suckers to have around your house, or just outside it. By having just one of these plants, you suck 2 gallons out of the air CO2 a week! If you pair this with automatic irigation, then save old water bottles and soda bottles from the Landfills and use them to water your CO2 sucking buddies! 


https://www.amazon.com/ofnmy-Watering-Automatic-Irrigation-Vacation/dp/B07FDYSGN8/ref=sr_1_13?keywords=Water+bottle+plant+water&qid=1551291801&s=gateway&sr=8-13

text:
Like, really? Some people are so stupid and blind sided. And I literally met somebody who said

"Climate change doesn't exist because God made the world perfect and no change is needed." 

I literally stared at her. Does she even know what climate change is...? I hate humans. They suck and are toxic.

And yes, I know I'm a human too and we all make mistakes, but goddammit, we don't have lots of time to find a way to actually use the mistakes we make to better the world. It's either that or we are too selfish, lazy, and/or dumb to care about our planet, the only thing that is inhabitable currently.

Dear God people. Open those damn eyes and see the world is suffering. It isn't going to just fix its self! And second, it wouldn't even be this way if we didn't exist. I could write a whole essay on how the human race is stupid and arrogant but I think I'd literally be writing so long that It would take years to proofread and finalize.

And to people who say "save the planet!" But actually don't do anything. What are you achieving? Nothing.

text: So. Much. Wong. With. This. Please try to find the episode of "Adam Ruins Everything" about "going green" and find out just how fucked up this video is. Plus unless the device you just watched this on was powered by unicorn farts you just helped out in contributing to "climate change". I must also include the material your device is made of, how it was made, assembled,  and shipped to you is in the same unicorn fart category. Wait almost forgot all of the shipping (boat, plane, train, truck) and the fuel they run on plus all of the energy and materials used to make those items so the shipping can take place. See it is not just a few simple things and rainbows and sunshine appear. Climate change is not a settled science as celebrity types want you to believe. So much has been disproven so far. Gore said the ice caps would be gone almost twenty years ago. They're still here and now getting larger. Even scientists who were for this within NASA are doing a reversal. Many now believe we are actually going into a cooling period and this "warm up" was just itself an odd occurrence. Stop looking at Hollywood for your science and look at the real people doing it. text:
"The planet is fine, the PEOPLE are fucked." - George Carlin.

Life Noggin, I like your videos and climate change is real, but I just want to remind you that we're not doing this to "save the planet." We're doing it to protect the environment we live in. The earth has been through bigger shit than we could ever do to it. For example, the earth has had more CO2 in its atmosphere in the past than we could ever hope to pump out today. The planet will go on with or without us as it's always been. What I'm trying to say is maybe you should focus on the idea that we should do something about climate change because it's beneficial to US rather than we're "trying to save the planet" which sounds very arrogant tbh. That's all.

text: this may be a bit surprising, but ending the United States EPA would actually help climate change. The EPA as a whole is actually pretty bad, same with government health insurance. Their goals are good but the way it's done needs to change. Think about it this way, would you get earthquake insurance if you lived in new york state, or flooding insurance in a plateau region of the USA? Same goes with the EPA. Different states can do different things. Some states with better economies can do different things when it comes to climate change. One state, if its close to the ocean, can use the seawater, turn it to fresh water and use it for drinking maybe export what they dont use to other states. Another state could plan to turn the vast deserts into bio diverse ecosystems. Even entire states could plan to go all renewable. Point being, national run things are complete shit whether its healthcare, the epa, insurance, etc.

text:
What Can You Do RIGHT NOW To Save The Earth?  Nothing, the earth is doing just fine. Humans maybe about to die, but the planet will be fine for about five billion more years - then the sun will eat it.

Also, the impact of global warming is over blown, just like all the other disasters that were supposed to destroy us. Remember the population bomb? Or that we would run out of oil many years ago? Or that we would nuke ourselves into oblivion?

Is the globe warming? Yes it is. Will we all die any day now? Don't be absurd. The people who are telling you that humanity will be extinct in ten years, or by 2035, or by 2050 are trying to scare you; not giving you scientifically proven results. How can I say this? Because their terrifying predictions of the past haven't come true either.

Should we treat the planet better? Yes. Do we have to do it immediately? No. In 2002 8.9% of the energy the United States generated came from renewable sources. In 2013 it was 12.87%. Things are getting better every year and even Trump can't effect that world wide.

text:
I urge you not to read if you do not want to be scared, I beg of you.






The average human uses 90 gallons of water per day(sounds highly unlikely, but true.)Using this with the current rate of consumption and the fresh water amount I've gathered from the start of 2017. I've estimated in 2030 we will consume 765 billion gallons of fresh water a day, and as of 2017 the amount of fresh water is 108 quintillion gallons. Now some of this data may not be accurate, but they come from reliable sources.
Furthermore due to the current rate of consumption of oil, it will run out in 53 years. Natural gas will run out in 54, as of coal 110 years. Using this data I guess we have 43 years left as of 2017 until we run out of fresh water, oil, and natural gas.Correct me if I'm wrong, but we don't have very much time to live on earth.
   Sure, human beings can invent an alternative method for surviving.(it might even happen in our lifetime).But given current statistics, we have little time to do so. Now granted, this sounds like another 'end of the world' theory were mass hysteria ensues. I also may be comeplety wrong. (Which I hope to god is the case) and feel free to correct me.HOWEVER. If I'm right, and the world might end in 43 years.Know that time is short and you are loved more than you think so.Thank you for your time
-M

text: I've watched 30 seconds of this video and normally I don't comment until finishing the video but when u say "If the destination is close enough, consider walking or riding a bike. Carbon dioxide or CO2 is a major contributor to climate change." How short r u referring to? Anything including and below a mile in a metropolitan area and half a mile in an urban area? I mean anything farther than those rough estimates for the sake of saving CO2 usage is just bizarre. I think u forgot to include how much CO2 is produced when coal burns, which is used to make electricity, which is used to power the factories, which make your meat ready to be made into a hamburger, which is shipped to your restaurant that you're eating your burger at, which is using electricity, made by burning coal, to heat and make your burger taste good, which is then eaten by someone like u. Which u being a human use the energy from that burger to power your muscles as u walk to your destination instead of using your car which only uses CO2 while running and in the shipment of the gas it uses. Soooooooooooooooooo... I would just like you to be more open to all the things needed to be powered and/or delivered to fuel your walk to your destination. :) Thx for reading this whole thing

text: Eating less meat would be even worse. If companies loose money on a certain product, various meat products for instance they are encouraged to get more non-meat products, which would make meat farmers have even more animals in their ranches because no one is buying the meat they already have, so they loose money unless they can find a way to start growing some more non-meat products quickly before they go down under from the maintenance it cost to keep their animals that no one is buying. Farmers most likely sell to factories, factories that make the meat edible. This is packaged and then sold to stores. So if stores buy non meat products to gain more money, then those factories and ranchers loose more money. See where I went? I said it twice to make sure it got in there correctly. No I did not dislike the video or anything, nor did I like it before X-TREME vegans start flagging this comment.

text: WilliamRC04 Electric cars may not make CO2, but the power plant that feeds them will. Unless we massively expand nuclear or pull out a cheap, low environmental impact battery storage system soon then electric cars ultimately catalyze more CO2 emissions than a comparable gas engine
author: Jacob

text:
WilliamRC04 Michael is asking the right questions, the only time we see comparable global warming due to fossil fuels is during a mass extinction where mass volcanic eruptions ignited massive coal mines.

Long story short after 10,000 years of modern day emission averages the planet warmed by 5 degrees. That's it. 800-1200ppm CO2 concentration, 10K years, life still moved on. So frankly what we're doing is a very minor shift all things considered

author: Clarity-1

text: No, we'll be fine in 2050. In fact, the most extreme predictions by the top climate organizations don't predict human extinction between now and 2100. Worst case scenario we see a 2-2.5 degree rise between now and 2100. In the mean time higher CO2 levels mean all plant life grows faster, using less water, and produces higher crop yields that outweigh expected losses through variations  in growing seasons. We can actually do nothing and be fine, its just those outcomes aren't optimal.
author: Jacob

text: If all the ice in the ocean melts, nothing will happen. Since the ice is already displacing water, turning it into water has a zero net effect. The only concern is Antarctica, however the majority of the continent is actually increasing its ice volume while the only losses in ice just so happen to be over nearly 100 underground volcanoes that are becoming more active. We can't change volcanic activity no matter how much CO2 we do/don't release.
author: Jacob

text:
The question is, where do you get solar cells?

You mine the the materials, likely from China or another nation with low environmental standards, which takes lots of energy and resources. You apply energy to put the parts together, then hopefully you get a decent return on energy investment. Problem is that you can't store extra energy (at least without battery costs soaring beyond all other sources of energy) and this is what Germany has found out. 

Germany moved to about 25% renewable energy, and now they pay other nations to take their excess while relying on coal power in between. Their energy grid is having serious instability problems because of this, which is also why they have one of the highests energy prices in the developed world. Solar is great for a house per say, not for mass energy production.

text:
List of FIVE things you could do right now to change CO2 problem. That you‚Äôve probably never heard of before.


Join Charity Miles:
An app like pokemon go that tracks you while you go outside and for each mile, you are able to donate to a charity. Including some that plant a tree for each donation. BONUS save on gas and lower your CO2 by walking or biking to places instead of driving to them.


Switch to Ecosia:
Plant a tree for searching the web. The web browser had just as much information on it as Google, but for every 45 searches and 10 advertisements you see online, a tree is planted. It‚Äôs the easiest switch to start helping the planet. 


Play Tree Planet:
An app that plants trees for every download and wins points by playing fun games to go toward planting more!


HTC Power:
Download the HTC Power To Give and connect your Android smartphone when you go to bed.
Your HTC smartphone‚Äôs processing power will fuel a research-based grid aimed at solving the world‚Äôs biggest questions. Contribute to human needs in the fields of medicine, science and environmental causes with HTC Power To Give.


Rocketbook:
A reusable notebook! The fewer trees we cut down for paper the better, and this notebook can be reused hundreds of times for school, work or writing notes. Once a page is full, take a picture and a digital copy of your work will be made, so you never lose your work and can study or see your notes on the go. AND when its full, pop it in the microwave and watch as everything disappears! Use again and again and never worry about buying another notebook again!


BONUS:


Houseplants: 
Clearing CO2 with trees is a good start, but clearing CO2 with houseplants can also help reduce a lot of CO2 produced. Researchers say that Japanese royal ferns, spider plants, Boston ferns, purple waffle plants, English ivy, areca palms, golden pothos, aloe vera, air plants, snake plants, and peace lilies are the best CO2 suckers to have around your house, or just outside it. By having just one of these plants, you suck 2 gallons out of the air CO2 a week! If you pair this with automatic irigation, then save old water bottles and soda bottles from the Landfills and use them to water your CO2 sucking buddies! 


https://www.amazon.com/ofnmy-Watering-Automatic-Irrigation-Vacation/dp/B07FDYSGN8/ref=sr_1_13?keywords=Water+bottle+plant+water&qid=1551291801&s=gateway&sr=8-13

text:
There is very little you can do on your own to combat climate change so I kind of see this sort of reasoning like a red herring and ultimately counterproductive to the cause because it's a "feel good" distraction from the real issues. This is the sort of change that needs to happen top-down from incentives and regulation, not bottom-up from individual initiative. 

You personally reducing your footprint out of principle is just going to shift that consumption elsewhere because of basic supply and demand. There is just not going to be a critical mass of people with sufficient personal motivation to "organically" make systematic changes on the order of magnitude that is needed. Ultimately this needs a political solution - so use your vote and/or lend your support to groups that fight for this sort of political change.

The tip to heat/cool your house less is good though just because that's the #1 energy consumption in any household. It's not going to save the environment, but it's going to be good for your wallet.

text:
Your comment that not all plants are better than all meats for the environment doesn't make sense. Do you have sources for this fact in the scientific literature? If we stopped eating meat livestock would no longer be bred in huge numbers, drastically reducing the number of animals alive on earth (especially species like cows that contribute a lot to global warming from methane production). It also takes more crops to feed livestock to feed people than to just grow plants to feed people (it takes 18x more land to feed a meat eater than a vegan) so we could actually replant huge numbers of trees to aid in CO2 sequestration. 
This information is widely available and clearly shows that a vegan diet is the best option for the environment.

text:
Eh millions of jobs is a pretty big stretch for solar and wind energy. Sure technology as a whole will add lots of jobs, but not energy. Think about it like this: Natural Gas motivates about 2.1 million jobs across the US while creating 1/3 the energy, meanwhile solar only employs 260k workers and provides about 1%the workers. Natural Gas motivates dozens of different industries involving high-paying STEM fields while Solar energy primarily revolves around sales, installation, and manufacturing all of which would be lower paying than Natural Gas.

Nuclear+ Nat Gas > Renewables. They're a nice cost reducer, but will never be relied on.

author: Skyler Ricketts

text:
List of FIVE things you could do right now to change CO2 problem. That you‚Äôve probably never heard of before.


Join Charity Miles:
An app like pokemon go that tracks you while you go outside and for each mile, you are able to donate to a charity. Including some that plant a tree for each donation. BONUS save on gas and lower your CO2 by walking or biking to places instead of driving to them.


Switch to Ecosia:
Plant a tree for searching the web. The web browser had just as much information on it as Google, but for every 45 searches and 10 advertisements you see online, a tree is planted. It‚Äôs the easiest switch to start helping the planet. 


Play Tree Planet:
An app that plants trees for every download and wins points by playing fun games to go toward planting more!


HTC Power:
Download the HTC Power To Give and connect your Android smartphone when you go to bed.
Your HTC smartphone‚Äôs processing power will fuel a research-based grid aimed at solving the world‚Äôs biggest questions. Contribute to human needs in the fields of medicine, science and environmental causes with HTC Power To Give.


Rocketbook:
A reusable notebook! The fewer trees we cut down for paper the better, and this notebook can be reused hundreds of times for school, work or writing notes. Once a page is full, take a picture and a digital copy of your work will be made, so you never lose your work and can study or see your notes on the go. AND when its full, pop it in the microwave and watch as everything disappears! Use again and again and never worry about buying another notebook again!


BONUS:


Houseplants: 
Clearing CO2 with trees is a good start, but clearing CO2 with houseplants can also help reduce a lot of CO2 produced. Researchers say that Japanese royal ferns, spider plants, Boston ferns, purple waffle plants, English ivy, areca palms, golden pothos, aloe vera, air plants, snake plants, and peace lilies are the best CO2 suckers to have around your house, or just outside it. By having just one of these plants, you suck 2 gallons out of the air CO2 a week! If you pair this with automatic irigation, then save old water bottles and soda bottles from the Landfills and use them to water your CO2 sucking buddies! 


https://www.amazon.com/ofnmy-Watering-Automatic-Irrigation-Vacation/dp/B07FDYSGN8/ref=sr_1_13?keywords=Water+bottle+plant+water&qid=1551291801&s=gateway&sr=8-13

text:
These animals would have gone extinct if humans didn't eat them.

If humans were straight up vegan from the get go, these animals would have been in our way and challenged our expansion.
We'd have needed room for our farms and these "pests" would have come in stealing our food. We would kill them and toss them aside. They would retreat into wilds where they would have predators they've never seen before like wolves, snow leopards, tigers, bears, and more.

They would all be dead. Every cow on this planet descends from one group tamed 10,000 years ago. ONE. Humans could have chosen to kill them or farm them, and they chose to farm them which has allowed them to exist today.

Pigs only survived because of their incredible immune system. Before plumbing, your toilet would go to an underground bunker, then you'd send the pigs in to "clean" it up. After they eat the unprocessable-by-human waste, you can eat them (of course you give them other things as well, like rotten vegetables or bad eggs). If humans didn't eat them, their only purpose for existing would be eating shit and dying. They'd be worse off than slaves until plumbing is invented, then they'd have no purpose to exist anymore.

text: Earth's weather is controlled by the sun.  When the sun heats up (which is what it's doing), so does the earth.  The theory for global warming says that CO2 (and other gases) is trapping heat (which is coming from the sun) and thus making it hotter.  If this was true then the Earth would be getting hotter as the sun got colder.   This is quite clearly false.

text:
How is seeing the film taking action?   That would actually make things worse by encouraging people to consume more power and resources in order to watch the movie, as well as support the companies behind the GMO popcorn, the high fructose corn syrup snacks, the fossil fuels, and the chemicals in the water supply.   And besides, if you don't know what's going on by now then you must be obscenely ignorant to the blatantly obvious, and i don't think wasting resources to see the film will be offset by any substantial change to these people anyways.

So what other steps can one take besides these trivial, symbolic ones?   I've been vegan for over a decade now, have been nearly off direct fossil fuel usage for almost as long, and have been living entirely in solar power for the last 7 years.   I default to used products when available and reasonable instead of demanding new stuff.   I don't buy consumable paper products like napkins or toilet paper, except as required for my business, which is also solar and pedal powered.   At my other job, i aggressively institute policies of recycling, reducing waste, and water reuse for the crew, and any leftover food is donated to our local organization that gets it to people who need it.   

I'm pretty much at the limit of what i can do myself unless i stop farting and burning incense.
author: Rusty Mustard

text:
Going to pay for overpriced propaganda isn't education.   If the message was so important it'd be freely available to everyone, and they could still make money from ad revenue.   The fact that it shares a screen with Hollywood's fantasies alone goes a long way towards discrediting it when highly profit driven, exploitative industry is hustling 'education' alongside titties and violence.   The fact that the theaters are profiting from this discredits the entire film which is probably going to tell us at some point to "follow the money".   Well, follow it right into the pockets of fucking Monsanto, for both the GM corn and the Roundup hustle, where it's basically being funneled from the snack bar, or to the power companies they are hypocritically blamed and chastised in the film.

How much profit is going to be made from this?  How much of that supports change?

And that's the problem, those who are damn convinced they're "awake" have just switched propaganda channels run for a profit.   There's big money in selling the ignorant bias reinforcement and selling bias reinforcement trendily packaged while only considering one side of an issue is just as insulting and disgusting as the 'deniers' and industry supporters.

Both sides of the issue are being led around by the ideological and political nose hairs, but the self-righteousness and surety of the left fosters an arrogant smugness that prevents many from seeing that both sides are being paraded down the capitalist midway and forced to consume by the SAME GODDAMNED INDUSTRY SELLING YOU WHAT YOU WANT TO HEAR based on reinforcing biases and treating the polar concerns as irrelevant, therefore creating a social divide for profit

This is just one of the more disgusting profit schemes i've seen lately because it preys on genuine fear and hope for a less shitty future than we're already in for and then lulls the hopeful into a false sense that someone else is taking action and eating "kale" once a week is you being a fucking climate avenger.

The same media conglomerates are selling the right polar propaganda that is outside of your bias bubbles, realize that and wake up to the fact that if you REALLY want things to be better, WE HAVE TO WORK OUR HARDEST AND MAKE SACRIFICES OF CONVENIENCE AND COMFORT TO EXIST WITHIN A SUSTAINABLE FRAMEWORK.   This means that you only have so much power from your solar panels, or materials for new and disposable products, and when you use it up that's it.   Right now we're existing in a global energy and resource deficit and that has to change RIGHT THE HELL NOW BY ACTIONS THAT APPROPRIATELY MIRROR THE URGENCY AND IMPORTANCE OF THE PROBLEM.   

As i have been doing all my life, i exist minimally, and am hyperconscious of the impact of every one of my decisions because it's what's needed by the numbers.   There's not enough "stuff" to go around and by taking more than my share i'm not being responsible.   Yet when i post as an example of the kinds of personally responsible actions like making your own power or not needing a vehicle, people act like i'm doing it for some selfish means.   I'm trying to educate by example of the aggressive conservation effort that is both needed and being put into living practice by those who choose to take meaningful action instead of kicking the can of guilt down the road by seeing a film to make you feel like you might have done some little thing.

It's hard, you've been indoctrinated by an pro-environment propaganda structure the same that the other side has and seeing someone do the most ecologically responsible thing without being subject to the artificial limitations of thinking someone else has to build solar panels and sell power to me before i can have it.   And to tell the truth, i don't have any kids, or family and my body is so worn out that in a decade or two i'll be gone and will never see the long term result of my action, so it should matter least to me in theory, but that's not what it's about.   None of this is about benefit for me or mine, it's for every person who has gone their whole lives seeing a drama of lies that they KNOW is an act play out in an uncontrollable spiral of negativity in order to pay lip service to your choice of propaganda.   Adam Smith economics of choice is being presented as your choice of controlled demographic subsets using the game theory of John Nash. 

See if you can force yourself to stand back and listen to the propaganda and recognize it when viewed with unbiased critical thinking.   Maybe you'll see that behind most things you're presented with that support your ideological views are the same manipulative practices that target the subset's psychological weaknesses.


.
author: Rusty Mustard

text:
Sorry to tell you this, but refusing to eat something because it was modified is a crock of shit. Just about everything you eat was modified at some point in history, vegan or not. There isn't a single common food crop that hasn't been modified via at least cross pollination and selective breeding, which, guess what, make them a GMO. What took humans trial and error for decades or even centuries we can now do in labs faster, and most of it is still via botanical grafts, cross pollination and selective breeding.

Insertion of new genes is quite rare, if you think scientists just bombard plants with radiation or insert random genes into them you must be pretty naive. If it wasn't for modifying plant species we cultivate we'd likely have gone extinct long, long ago. But please, by all means go on about how evil GMO's are, and ignore real issues such as monsanto forcing farmers to buy seed that produces crops that cannot seed, forcing farmers into a vicious cycle of buying expensive seed over and over.

Adding some genetics to rice to make it rich in vitamin A or changing a chicken so its eggs contain omega 3 is far from evil, especially next to some other practices out there.

And sorry to burst your bubble on the solar, but your panels and batteries are horrible to the environment to produce. And when you inevitably have to replace them because they wear out they'll be just as horrible. Sure you might send them off for "proper recycling", but do you know where a lot of E waste goes? Villages in China and Africa where it's burned, buried or lightly picked through for only the most valuable reclaimable parts. Then the rest is left to poison the land for 100's if not 1000's of years.

Here's another fun one for the walkers and bicyclists too, even on a vegan diet, what do you think helps make your food? Tractors, trucks and harvesting equipment don't run on solar power or elf farts. If you actually do the math, if your food is grown by standard means riding a bike has around equivalent carbon emissions due to the calories burned. It only gets worse if you go "organic", due to the vastly lowered yields. It's the same conundrum as buying an electric car.

No matter how high your horse, you're just another human running around who's ultimately a slave to the machine that is human society. Much of everything you do is far outside your hands. So how's about you climb down off that high horse now?

This happens too fast to be natural, and plus, 97% of scientists also belive it is human made, and i belive they know more about climate change than a hill billy like Trump.
author: Wilhelm Thomsen

text: Wilhelm Thomsen True, but ice in general has been receding for several millenia. Disregarding the issues around the 97% agreement by scientists (full study showed only 97% of the >5% of scientists who were contacted agreed, strong volunteer bias) climate change has been influenced by the sun first, then atmosphere or volcanic activity tie for second. Example, the Western Ice sheet in Antarctica has seen greater melting than normal. Turns out detailed analysis found 97 underground volcanoes that weren't accounted for, and were mostly active. I figure since we don't know climate well enough to make accurate climate predictions, we don't know enough to call doomsday. But it's great to hear your perspective.

author: lisa walters

text: lisa walters You completely missed the point. While other foods can provide levels of protein, a vegetarian/vegan is missing out on COMPLETE protein, which is found in animal by-product. Not only do you get amino acids, but animo acids containing dietary sulfur. A low intake of this (from the vegetarian/vegan diet) could result in issues such as high blood levels of homocysteine, potentially leading to blood clots. Just because you were supposedly "normal", does not mean all humans can live healthy off a vegetarian/vegan diet.
author: JUSTANOTHERTROLL

text:
megaloveniafaller First off, that claim is false. Quinoa contains a "complete protein." Second off, your claim about not getting enough "complete proteins" is just downright wrong. You can eat different foods at different times which give you all the amino acids you need. If one is worried about this, they can hop onto https://cronometer.com/ and look at the amino acids they are getting. If you are eating a balanced vegan diet with variety, getting your different amino acids is not a challenge. Trust me, my parents made me track my diet on cronometer for months, I know how extremely easy to it is to get protein and amino acids. 

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/natural-health/busted-the-myth-about-incomplete-plant-based-protein/ "The idea that all essential amino acids must be eaten together at each meal isn‚Äôt true like we used to think. One can eat a variety of foods that are rich in essential and non-essential amino acids, and completely get their fill of protein. Many plant-based foods are filled with all essential amino acids"

https://www.forksoverknives.com/the-myth-of-complementary-protein/#gs.i==UfHo "The ‚Äúincomplete protein‚Äù myth was inadvertently promoted and popularized in the 1971 book, Diet for a Small Planet, by Frances Moore Lapp√©... She was not a nutritionist, physiologist, or medical doctor; she was a sociologist trying to end world hunger."

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19562864 "It is the position of the American Dietetic Association that appropriately planned vegetarian diets, including total vegetarian or vegan diets, are healthful, nutritionally adequate, and may provide health benefits in the prevention and treatment of certain diseases. Well-planned vegetarian diets are appropriate for individuals during all stages of the life cycle, including pregnancy, lactation, infancy, childhood, and adolescence, and for athletes."

Please provide evidence to back up your claims. And please, try to tell me that the American Dietetic Association is wrong. What qualifies you more than the ADA?

text:
"It is the position of the American Dietetic Association that appropriately planned vegetarian diets, including total vegetarian or vegan diets, are healthful, nutritionally adequate, and may provide health benefits in the prevention and treatment of certain diseases. Well-planned vegetarian diets are appropriate for individuals during all stages of the life cycle, including pregnancy, lactation, infancy, childhood, and adolescence, and for athletes."

Source: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19562864

It's true that the first thing babies need to eat is milk. But they need mother's milk, that is, milk from a human evolved to cover a human baby's nutritional needs, not cow milk evolved to cover the needs of a calf. Breast milk is obviously vegan, as no animals were exploited to obtain it. There are vegan formulas for those who cannot breastfeed their child, and not all are soy-based.

The ADA isn't the only dietitian/nutritionist association to say that: its Canadian and Australian equivalents also support vegan diets, and the British Dietetic Association started working together with The Vegan Society to ensure vegans in the UK know how to eat healthily.

Furthermore, look at the WHO healthy diet recommendations and tell me where it says animal products are necessary:

"A healthy diet [for an adult] contains:
- Fruits, vegetables, legumes (e.g. lentils, beans), nuts and whole grains (e.g. unprocessed maize, millet, oats, wheat, brown rice).
- At least 400 g (5 portions) of fruits and vegetables a day (2). Potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and other starchy roots are not classified as fruits or vegetables.
- Less than 10% of total energy intake from free sugars (2, 5) which is equivalent to 50 g (or around 12 level teaspoons) for a person of healthy body weight consuming approximately 2000 calories per day, but ideally less than 5% of total energy intake for additional health benefits (5). Most free sugars are added to foods or drinks by the manufacturer, cook or consumer, and can also be found in sugars naturally present in honey, syrups, fruit juices and fruit juice concentrates.
- Less than 30% of total energy intake from fats (1, 2, 3). Unsaturated fats (e.g. found in fish, avocado, nuts, sunflower, canola and olive oils) are preferable to saturated fats (e.g. found in fatty meat, butter, palm and coconut oil, cream, cheese, ghee and lard) (3). Industrial trans fats (found in processed food, fast food, snack food, fried food, frozen pizza, pies, cookies, margarines and spreads) are not part of a healthy diet.
- Less than 5 g of salt (equivalent to approximately 1 teaspoon) per day (6) and use iodized salt."

Source: http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs394/en/

Please, don't go around spreading misinformation.

text: A thermostat is not the same as having ac. A thermostat is just a device that regulates how much your ac or your heater runs. Eg in most northern European countries ppl don't have ac because it doesn't get that hot in summer but most ppl have thermostats to control the heating in winter. If you set your heating manually, you'll actually waste energy. Ppl install thermostats because they save a lot of energy and money, the thing pays for itself.

text:
Angrybirds 18 well if you don't have a thermostat then you're wasting(!) energy. Controlling your heating or ac manually would be a full time job - as the outside  temp changes over the course of the day you should adjust how much you cool or heat to save energy. eg the ac should turn off automatically at night, your heater usually can run less at noon and at night when you sleep etc.
btw: it doesn't have to be a central device; actually, those intelligent knobs you can buy for the heaters of your central heating are thermostats as well.
Btw2: what's with this "haha in Europe we don't need no ac or thermostats"? I live in Europe and have relations all over and I know this: in Spain, Italy, Greece everyone who can somehow afford it has an ac. To the north of the alps (Austria, Germany etc), ppl usually don't have ac but all the energy conscious use thermostats with their heating because it saves so much money.
Well, maybe not the British, but they never considered themselves real Europeans anyway. And maybe not Romanians and Bulgarians because they can't afford it but in the rest of Europe we do invest in thermostats and in the hotter countries ppl have ac as well. We just don't use it as over the top as in the US where you always have to put on a jacket when you enter a house because it's so fricken cold, like below 17 Celsius in summer. That's wasteful - which is the point of the vid - set your things to a reasonable setting and you'll save so much energy. Eg cool your home only so it feels like stepping into a nice shade, not like stepping into a fridge. You'll still be mighty comfortable.

text:
Everything you need to know:

1. What is a fart?
A fart, or flatulence, as it is also known, is intestinal gas. The gas comes from either the air you swallow, or because of bacteria in the colon. Every time you swallow, you swallow ten millilitres of air. If you chew gum, you are constantly swallowing air. Ventriloquists in fact use swallowed air to speak. If burping does not bring the air back up, it will travel through the entire intestinal system, which is six to seven metres long.

2. How much air are we talking about?
A study found that during 24 hours, 30 litres of air would pass through the intestinal system. Most of the air consists of nutrients that work as building blocks that are important for your body. Most of the bowel gas gets sucked up into the blood, leaving approximately 200 millilitres to be let out. Intestinal gas is healthy, without it we would die.

3. What does intestinal gas contain?
Intestinal gas consists mainly of nitrogen, carbon dioxide and hydrogen. It also contains smaller amounts of sulphur, which helps create the foul smell.

4. How much do we fart?
As previously stated, we release approximately 200 millilitres of intestinal gas during the day. Most people will release the daily amount of gas through ten to twenty emissions. When we eat, the food we swallow is absorbed and works as food for the bacteria located in the colon. The colon contains ten thousand billion bacteria. That is ten times more than the total number of cells in the human body. The bacteria are sustained through the food you eat.

5. Are there any different kinds of farts?
I personally distinguish between the silent guerrilla farts, that often stink pretty badly, and the noisy farts, which usually do not smell as bad as the guerrilla farts, despite being more explosive.

6. Why do we get bloated?
Everybody gets bloated from raw onions, peas, and cabbage, to name a few obvious candidates. These food products contain heavily digestible carbohydrates, which are very popular among bacteria. If the gas piles up, and there is too much of it, the volume will increase and put stress on the intestinal wall, which in turn leads to pain and discomfort. This is typical during Christmas time, as people tend to eat fat food, which leads to pain caused by the enlarged volume of gas.

7. Why is farting embarrassing?
The most embarrassing part of farting would probably be the smell and noise. Everything that comes out of your body is kind of embarrassing. For instance, stinking of sweat is not very fun either. It is uncomfortable for the world around you, just like with farts.

8. Is it dangerous to keep a fart in?
No one has ever died from holding in a fart; it can, however, be very painful. People are different; men fart without caring too much about the surroundings. Women may be more strongly inclined to try and keep a fart in, which will make their stomachs feel like a balloon. If you spend the entire day at the office holding in all your farts, it can pile up and lead to pains and stomach aches. Let it out, is what I always say, concludes Trygve Hausken.
